alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 10:50PM CDT until June 12 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following county, Johnson. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Burleson, Cleburne, Keene, Joshua, Alvarado, Pecan Plantation, Venus, Grandview, Godley, Cross Timber, Lake Pat Cleburne, Cleburne State Park, Lake Whitney, Parker, Rio Vista, Briaroaks, Coyote Flats, Sand Flat, Egan and Lillian.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
